title: Velvet Coloring Posters: Modern Floral Frameable Wall Art

desc: A young woman living in a rigid, puritanical society discovers dark powers within herself in this stunning, feminist fantasy debut.

title: Languishing: How to Feel Alive Again in a World That Wears Us Down
desc: With his pioneering research, Corey Keyes put languishing on the map. In this powerful book, he brings it to life. Get ready to rethink your understanding of mental health, update your views on happiness, and come closer to realizing your potential.

title: Friday Black
desc: An unbelievable debut, one that announces a new and necessary American voice. New York Times Book Review The acclaimed debut collection from the author of Chain Gang All Stars; a piercingly raw and, at times, heartbreakingly satirical look at what it's like to be young and Black in America.

title: The Brilliant Life of Eudora Honeysett
desc: It's never too late to start living. Eudora Honeysett is done with this noisy, moronic world--all of it

title: The Last Negroes at Harvard: The Class of 1963 and the 18 Young Men Who Changed Harvard Forever
desc: The untold story of the Harvard class of '63, whose Black students fought to create their own identities on the cusp between integration and affirmative action.

title: The Narrows
desc: Petry is the writer we have been waiting for; hers are the stories we need to fully illuminate the questions of our moment, while also offering a page-turning good time.

desc: Penned as a series of letters from a renowned artist to his child, who seeks to overcome a traumatic childhood

title: Right on Cue
desc: From the beloved author of Just My Type and Lease on Love comes a new romantic comedy

title: Moon of the Turning Leaves
desc: Waubgeshig Rice's stories are good medicine. Moon of the Turning Leaves is a restorative balm for my spirit.

title: Dead Weight: Essays on Hunger and Harm
desc: A personal and cultural look at the dark underbelly of Western beauty standards and the lethal culture of disordered eating they've wrought

title: Blank
desc: A wife, mother, and frustrated writer faces an impossible deadline for turning her life around in a hilarious debut novel about family, friendship, success, and exhilarating self-(re)discovery.

title: The Turner House
desc: Flournoy's knockout debut is one of those books that should, by rights, be described as the Great American Novel.

desc: You can be beautiful, even more beautiful than before.

title: Dead of Night
desc: It starts with a simple request: check up on the mysteriously reclusive biologist brother of an old friend. But what Doc Ford stumbles upon in the doctor's secluded island home is a nightmare.
